title: Recognise
snippet: Acknowledging key patterns and relationships in urban spaces
description: Recognising in urban planning involves identifying recurring patterns and relationships that define a space. This skill allows planners to see beyond the visible, discovering underlying trends and social behaviors that shape urban life.
literature: Collage City by Colin Rowe and Fred Koetter
Seeing Like a State by James C. Scott
The Social Logic of Space by Bill Hillier and Julienne Hanson
